samples.question: What are the differences between group traveling and traveling alone?
samples.transcript: So I would say there are many differences which I would like to talk about right now. so the first difference will be the peace of mind because personally speaking I would prefer going solo because when whenever we are traveling in the group we have to take the advice for from each and every person >> and not every person is same and not every person's interest on traveling similar yes it is not similar. >> so traveling solo is if I am traveling solo I would say I would spend most of the time without even thinking that >> can you tell me something general not personal okay so generally I have seen people traveling solo because in their cases they they do not have time to just think about anything they can go any at any random restaurant which they like >> and if they are traveling in a group they have to take advice and they have to consider everyone for traveling and even the the food choices of the people are different. >> So I have seen many people not vibing along u when they are traveling just because their interests are not similar. >> Okay. Okay.

samples.question: What do we need to prepare for a long journey?
samples.transcript: For a long journey. I have seen people preparing a week in advance. Not even a week. I have seen people planning a month in advance so that they make sure that they do not forget anything. It includes shopping and getting appropriate outfits for the trip and also making it where they have to travel and see the places and they have to also research what kind of u what kind of transports and vehicles are used over there so that they can plan and book their accommodation and the rentals accordingly. >> Okay.

samples.question: When I asked her the first question, do you think it is good choice to travel by plane?

samples.question: What is your job?
samples.transcript: >> currently I am an interpreter over the phone. I interpret phone calls from different government agencies and institutions from the US.
samples.transcript_original: >> Uh, currently I'm an interpreter over the phone. I interpret phone calls from different government agencies and um institutions from the US.

samples.question: >> And has your job changed a lot in the past years?
samples.transcript: It actually has because up until August from this year, I used to be an English teacher. I had been an English teacher for over three years. But just recently, I decided to switch to a new job.

samples.question: Do you use headphones?
samples.transcript: >> I do use headphones. I actually have a pair of headphones. I got them about two months ago. they are very useful and I really like them.

samples.question: >> And when would you use your headphones?

samples.question: How frequently do you buy shoes?

samples.question: Why do people do charity for others?
samples.transcript: I think people do charity for others because it is part of the empathetic side of the human heart to just see the needs in other people and just help them out with that because everybody struggles.
samples.transcript_original: I think people do charity for others because it's part of the empathetic side of the human heart to just uh see the needs in other people and just help them out with that because everybody struggles.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I think people do charity for others because it is part of the empathetic side of the human heart to just see the needs in other people and just help them out with that because everybody struggles.

samples.question: >> And do you think charity work is a selfish thing to do?
samples.transcript: It depends of the intentions of the person that does it because some people generally help without expecting anything in return. But there is other people that expect some recognition or just to feel like they are good people for doing small actions.
samples.transcript_original: It depends of the intentions of the person that does it because some people generally uh help without expecting anything in return. But there's other people that expect some recognition or just to feel like they're uh good people for doing small actions.

samples.question: >> And what kinds of charities are there in your country?
samples.transcript: Oh, there are many charities in my country, but the most famous ones are Telotone, which is for disabled children, red nose for children with cancer, and there are many that help the elderly as well. >> Mhm.
samples.transcript_original: Oh, there are many charities in my country, but the most famous ones are Telotone, which is for uh disabled children, red nose for children with cancer, and there are many that help the elderly as well. >> Mhm.

samples.question: And which one do you think is more useful or is more needed for you, leave?
samples.transcript: I think all of them are important and useful but I think the ones related to children and the elderly are the most important ones.
samples.transcript_original: Um I think all of them are important and useful but I think the ones related to children and the elderly are the most important ones.

samples.question: >> Why do you think so?
samples.transcript: >> Because these are the groups that struggle the most that the children and elderly are some of the most vulnerable groups in society. So helping them with their health needs and life situations I think that is very important.
